Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameController
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
Creates, sets up and plays out a specific Game, handling player connections and disconnections.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController​(VirtualView client, int num, java.lang.String gameName)
      GameController constructor. Creates the first Player (associated with the VirtualView received as an argument), associating his ID and the color "r" (red). Creates a PlayerController for the first Player, associating the Player and his VirtualView. Creates the Game.
      Parameters:
      client - the VirtualView associated with the first player
      num - the number of players for the current game
      gameName - the name of the Game

  • Method Details

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns:
      "true" if the attribute running is true, false otherwise

    • isSetup

      public boolean isSetup()
      Returns:
      "true" if the attribute setup is true, false otherwise

    • setServer

      public void setServer​(Server server)
      Sets the Server that's hosting the Game.
      Parameters:
      server - the Server to set

    • setLogger

      public void setLogger​(Logger logger)
      Sets the Logger associated with the server.
      Parameters:
      logger - the Logger to set

    • log

      public void log​(java.lang.String message)
      Adds the Game's name at the beginning of the given message and logs it to the Logger.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to log

    • logError

      public void logError​(java.lang.String message)
      Adds the Game's name at the beginning of the given message and logs it to the Logger as an error message.
      Parameters:
      message - the error message to log

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Returns:
      the current Game

    • getControllers

      public java.util.ArrayList<PlayerController> getControllers()
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all the PlayerControllers for this Game

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(VirtualView client) throws GameEndedException
      Adds a new Player to the Game. Creates the new Player, associating his ID and a color ("g" as green for the second player and "b" as blue for the third player). Creates a PlayerController for the new Player, associating the Player and his VirtualView.
      Parameters:
      client - the VirtualView associated with the Player to add
      Throws:
      GameEndedException - when the Game is unexpectedly ended

    • gameSetUp

      public void gameSetUp()
      Handles the setup phase of the Game: creates a GodController for each God Card, adds all the God Cards to the Deck, picks the Cards for the Game, chooses the starting player and places the workers.

    • pickCards

      private void pickCards() throws IOExceptionFromController
      Allows picking Cards from the Deck containing all the 14 God Power Cards. If the Player who first signed up chooses to randomize the playable God Powers pool, the Cards are randomly picked from the Deck; otherwise, he chooses the Cards to use. In both cases, the Cards are assigned to the Players by asking him which one they want to use (starting from the player who was the second to sign up).
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • chooseStartPlayer

      private void chooseStartPlayer() throws IOExceptionFromController
      Asks the first Player who signed up who will be the starting player, and then sets it.
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • placeWorkers

      private void placeWorkers() throws IOExceptionFromController
      Allows placing all the Workers on the Board. Asks each Player the starting positions for both his Workers, starting from the Player who was chosen as the first one.
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • playGame

      private void playGame() throws IOExceptionFromController
      Before proceeding to the Game, checks if there any any always active God Powers. Then plays out the Game until a winner is found. Each Player's turn is in the end described by a string:
      • "next" if the Player properly moved and built and the game goes on;
      • "outOfMoves" if the Player lost because he can't perform a legal move;
      • "outOfBuilds" if the Player lost because he can't perform a legal build;
      • "outOfWorkers" if the Player lost because both his Workers were removed from the game;
      • "winConditionAchieved" if the Player won because one of his Workers reached level 3;
      • "godConditionAchieved" if the Player won because he achieved his God specific win condition.
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • checkPlayersNumber

      public boolean checkPlayersNumber()
      Returns:
      true if the Game has reached the maximum number of players, false otherwise

    • checkWorkers

      public void checkWorkers() throws IOExceptionFromController
      For every Player in the Game, checks if any of his Workers are able to move. If a Player has no Workers left, eliminates him.
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • checkDisconnection

      public void checkDisconnection​(java.lang.Exception e, PlayerController controller) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Checks whether the Player who disconnected is currently in the Game or not.
      Parameters:
      e - the caught disconnection exception
      controller - the controller to check
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • handleDisconnection

      public void handleDisconnection​(PlayerController controller)
      Handles the disconnection of a Player and, after notifying that disconnection, terminates the Game.
      Parameters:
      controller - the PlayerController associated to the Player who disconnected

    • eliminatePlayer

      private void eliminatePlayer​(Player player, java.lang.String reason) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Removes a Player who was eliminated from the Game: removes his Workers and his God's active modifier (if present), then notifies him of his loss. If only one Player is left, sets him as the winner. If there are two Players left, notifies them of the elimination of the third one.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to eliminate
      reason - the reason why the Player lost
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController is thrown

    • broadcastBuild

      public void broadcastBuild​(CellView buildPosition, Card godPower) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Calls the displayBuild method for each Player, so that the build can be displayed on screen.
      Parameters:
      buildPosition - the position of the build
      godPower - the God Card that eventually allowed this build
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • broadcastGameInfo

      public void broadcastGameInfo​(java.lang.String desc) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Broadcasts all the information associated with the current Game to all the Players.
      Parameters:
      desc - the description associated with this broadcast; can be
      • "playerJoined": sends Player info when a new Player joins the game;
      • "gameSetup": sends Player info after all Players have joined;
      • "boardSetup": sends Player info with their respective God Cards;
      • "gameStart": signals the end of the setup stage;
      • "turnStart": signals the beginning of a new turn;
      • a notifyLoss description: signals the loss of a Player in a 3 Player game.
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • broadcastMessage

      public void broadcastMessage​(java.lang.String message) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Broadcasts the message received as an argument to all the Players.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to show
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • broadcastMove

      public void broadcastMove​(java.util.HashMap<CellView,​CellView> moves, Card godPower) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Calls the displayMove method for each Player, so that the move can be displayed on screen.
      Parameters:
      moves - an HashMap containing one or two moves associated with a turn
      godPower - the God Card that eventually allowed this move
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • broadcastPlaceWorker

      public void broadcastPlaceWorker​(Cell workerPosition) throws IOExceptionFromController
      Calls the displayPlaceWorker method for each Player, so that the starting positions of the Worker can be displayed on screen.
      Parameters:
      workerPosition - the position of the Worker
      Throws:
      IOExceptionFromController - when an IOException from a specific PlayerController occurs

    • notifyDisconnection

      public void notifyDisconnection​(Player player)
      Notifies all Players of the disconnection of the Player received as an argument.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who disconnected

    • setWinner

      private void setWinner​(Player player, java.lang.String reason)
      Sets the Player received as an argument as the winner (for the reason received as an argument). Notifies each Player of his victory or loss.
      Parameters:
      player - the winner
      reason - the reason why the player won

    • gameOver

      void gameOver()
      Handles the end of the Game. Sets all the playerControllers to null and notifies all the Players that the Game is over.
